docs.text: Config_Model schema Classes Config - Configuration parameters for linkml model template Mixins Slots ➞classifiers - Trove classifiers for PyPI ➞generate - The set of components to generate ➞keywords - A list of keywords for PyPI ➞model_author - The primary author of the model ➞model_author_email - The email address of the model author ➞model_description - A detailed description of the model ➞model_name - The repository name of the model ➞model_organization - The github repository organization ➞model_py_name - The Python equivalent of the model name ➞model_root_class - Default class to load yaml and other instances into ➞model_synopsis - A short description of the model ➞model_url - URL of model documentation ➞root_schema - The name of the root schema file (sans ".yaml") Enums component - LinkML Component to generate Types Built in Bool str Defined Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value String ( str ) - A character string

docs.text: Enum: component LinkML Component to generate URI: conf:component Other properties Permissible Values Text Meaning graphql Emit model schema in GraphQL json Emit model schema in JSON jsonld_context Emit JSON-LD contexts for model instance to RDF transformations json_schema Emit JSON Schema rendering of the model model Include a copy of the model schema in the distribution owl Emit OWL representation of model schema rdf Emit RDF representation of model schema shex Emit ShEx representation of model schema sqlddl Emit SQL Data Definition Language (create table statements)

docs.text: Introduction This is a lightweight model for use in the linkml-model-template configuration file. It serves two purposes: 1) Documenting how one configures a new linkml-model for publication and 2) Providing an "our own dog food" use case for uses of LinkML
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This is a lightweight model for use in the linkml-model-template configuration file. It serves two purposes: 1) Documenting how one configures a new linkml-model for publication and 2) Providing an "our own dog food" use case for uses of LinkML
docs.title: Introduction
